data.title: Girls weekend trip to Cincinnati Art Museum to see Van Gogh exhibit
data.text:
6th floor king suite, immaculate. Stylish, very clean, well-stocked mini-bar, incredibly comfortable king bed and pillows, large bathroom. Room was a corner room and very quite. We never heard anyone outside the room, above or below us. 
 
Fun, interesting hotel. Quirky art pieces.
Location is downtown, very nice area. 
Staff was very nice and incredibly helpful.

data.title: A really great hotel!
data.text: It was just for one night in a studio suite,but it was really a remarkable stay!Staff was so nice,specially Amanda and Oona.It was one of the quietest hotel I haver ever stayed!Excellent location:places to visit,restaurants,were within walking distance!And it was a quite good experience to sleep in a modern art museum!!I strongly recommend this hotel for anyone who goes to Cincinatti!

data.title: Staying at a Gallery
data.text: Superb hotel.  Besides the great rooms with all the amenities and a relaxed and competent staff, the hotel has a great modern American Art Collection on the first two floors.  It was my first trip to Cincinnati but hope to have other chances to go and stay at this great place.

owner_response.author: Michael D, General Manager at 21c Museum Hotel Cincinnati, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for staying with us on your first visit to Cincinnati! We appreciate that you took time to leave feedback about your stay here. We change our art about every six months, so chances are good that we will have more for you to enjoy when you are here again. We look forward to welcoming you back!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wonderful to stay in an art museum!
data.text:
I was delighted to find that the 21c Museum hotel actually had an art gallery.  The exhibit changes; when I was there it was modern photography, mostly portraits.
My room was clean and comfortable and the restaurant was excellent!  They had a good wine selection and very interesting food -- one of their specialties is the burnt carrot salad.  It sounds bad, but was very good.  I recommend trying it.
The staff were friendly and helpful and made my stay pleasant.
If I had one suggestion, it would be to tell the guests when they are checking in that every time they open the minibar, the room gets charged.  I wanted to put a sandwich in there and found charges on my bill when I checked out. They took the charges off, of course, but it would have been better if I had known about it in the first place. The good news is that if you need a refrigerator, they will supply one in your room free of charge.  But you do have to ask.
All in all, a terrific experience

owner_response.author: Michael D, General Manager at 21c Museum Hotel Cincinnati, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your kind words and good advice. We are thrilled that you enjoyed the art so much. All of our properties change exhibits about every six months so there is always something new to experience in the galleries whether you are in Louisville, Bentonville, Durham, Oklahoma City or Lexington. Here, the Burnt Carrot Salad is a well-loved staple that anchors Metropole's seasonally changing menu (new challenge for you: the charcuterie with smoked grapes. The grapes do not win beauty awards but they are mouth-watering!).  Thank you again for your feedback. We hope to welcome you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Jam packed with interesting art
data.text: Both floors (1 & 2) are filled with very interesting contemporary art from the impressive info desk held up by thousands of Lilliputians to the arresting, larger than life penguin on the elevator. Takes little more than 30 minutes to see it all so get your parking fee's worth and combine it with the far larger Contemporary Art Museum next door; to the south.

owner_response.author: Michael D, General Manager at 21c Museum Hotel Cincinnati, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for sharing your recent experience visiting with our art. There is more art to discover in the restaurant and on each of the guest floors (these are by local artists), and we rotate our public gallery art about every six months. We invite you to check out our online calendar for free museum events as well as specials in the restaurant for even more to do. We hope to welcome you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Top notch experience!
data.text: This is not just a hotel, it is an experience. If you love art (and if you want to feel like you are part of an installation piece) and you love luxury hotels with great customer service, look no further! This is, hands down, my favorite hotel experience/stay to date. Food at the Metropole is fabulous! My boyfriend and I ate dinner and brunch there during our stay. Looking forward to returning soon!

owner_response.author: Michael D, General Manager at 21c Museum Hotel Cincinnati, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you! This may be the first time anyone has told us they felt a part of the art, and that is an achievement. We are thrilled that you enjoyed your experience with us and we look forward to your return
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fabulous
data.text: Just loved the hotel. Very contemporary, clean and interesting. Location was convenient to walk to stadium and restaurants. Staff was really friendly. Visited rooftop bar for predinner cocktails and cheese plate. Make sure to take the time to visit the artwork on display.

owner_response.author: Michael D, General Manager at 21c Museum Hotel Cincinnati, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Denise,
Thank you for taking time to share your comments about your stay here. We are very happy to hear that you were able to visit our Cocktail Terrace before it closed for the season. We do hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A successful mix between a business and boutique hotel
data.text:
Clean, truly smiling people at the reception desk and restaurant ( an exception in US)
Worth to mention the interesting art collection at second floor ,the excellent restaurant with few, tasty dishes for dinner and a great homemade mousli for breakfast.
Worth a stop if you pass by in Cincinnati for business or tourism.

owner_response.author: Michael D, General Manager at 21c Museum Hotel Cincinnati, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Fabio,
Your kind words are greatly appreciated and have been shared with our team. Thank you for highlighting your food experience as well the art. We change our menus seasonally and our art about every six months so we hope you'd consider a return visit to check out what's new. We would love to welcome you again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A pleasant surprise at a uniquely quirky boutique hotel!
data.text: I am pleasantly surprised by the facilities and service of the 21c hotel. I always knew it had a great location, good restaurants and large art collections. But it's my first time experiencing its rooms - very clean, new and well-decorated rooms. It has everything you need and the friendly house keepers would hand you high quality dark chocolate in the morning! I love the soft bed and pillows and a large variety of TV channels available. The placement of giant yellow plastic penguins Metropole was a highlight of my day. Loved that humour! Same with all the quirky and funny decorations in the bathroom ;) Great stay overall!

owner_response.author: Michael D, General Manager at 21c Museum Hotel Cincinnati, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for sharing your impressions about your first stay here. We are happy that you enjoyed your room so much, from the decor to linens (we sell those at our online shop!). Our penguin flock exists to amuse and is pleased to know that you appreciated all the details that define a stay at 21c. We hope you have more opportunities to stay with us because we would love to welcome you again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: fun times at a boutique hotel
data.text: We booked last minute and didn't know what to expect as we'd done no research so were very pleasantly surprised with how well located, very cool and arty and fun this hotel was.  Everyone was great, the room was quite comfortable and the free bikes to borrow were the best way to spend a Sunday morning!

owner_response.author: Michael D, General Manager at 21c Museum Hotel Cincinnati, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank for your spontaneous reservation and stay with us! Your great feedback means a lot to us as well. We are glad to know that you took advantage of our bikes to explore our neighborhood. We hope to welcome you again soon for more fun and adventure in the Queen City.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: They created a wonderful memory for my Mom and me!
data.text: I won tickets to see Johnny Mathis.  My Dad died on Christmas Eve in 1985 and Johnny was his favorite artist.  My Mom is 86 and her love for Johnny Mathis stemmed from my Dad.  To be honest I planned the trip to C21 because of the location being across the street from the Aronoff Center and my Mom has great difficulty getting around.  Two days before we were to leave, my Mom's brother died.  Her only sibling and my Dad was an only child.  My husband and I talked her into taking the trip to get her mind off of the loss.  I cannot begin to tell you how full of gratitude I was when we arrived at 21C.  The staff was so caring and wonderful.  The valet team was all so attentive and helpful.  With my Mom's walker, our luggage, help crossing the street...everything!  Our waiter, Jeremy, was like meeting an old family friend.  He took such great care of us!  From the greeting at the reception desk by the super helpful team to the surprise at the end of our dinner...everything could not have been more perfect.  It all put a much needed smile on my Mom's face...more than once.  It was a much needed change from the tears of loss.  Thank you 21C for not only making our heavy hearts a little lighter but for giving us a great memory to always cherish!  We will return!

owner_response.author: Michael D, General Manager at 21c Museum Hotel Cincinnati, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello Lisa,
Thank you for sharing your experience and your gratitude here. Tuning in to your needs is our highest goal and we are so pleased to know how well we were able to do that for you and your mother during a bittersweet time for you both. We are grateful for the opportunity to lighten your hearts, from hello to goodbye, from first bite to last. Thank you also for choosing to stay with us; we hope to welcome you again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Well located hotel with great staff
data.text: I was in town last week for business and stayed at the hotel. The location is great and the people are very friendly. The rooms themselves are tired and in need of refreshing. For what is supposed to be "the best hotel in Cincinnati" the rooms needed fresh paint and carpet. The furniture was a little banged up as well. Overall, for the price, it was a good value.

owner_response.author: Michael D, General Manager at 21c Museum Hotel Cincinnati, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for sharing your comments about your recent stay. While we are pleased to hear that your experience was overall a good one, we are sorry that we fell short in areas where you thought we need "refreshing"; we are constantly working to address these concerns. Your feedback is appreciated and we do hope to welcome you back soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wonderful, unique & cool property
data.text: Such a neat place - really enjoyed the unique vibe - but for me, the attention to detail won me over. Very clean, very well kept and the staff was excellent. Already recommending this property to friends.

owner_response.author: Michael D, General Manager at 21c Museum Hotel Cincinnati, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you! Your kinds words and recommendation mean a lot to us. We appreciate that you took time to share your feedback and we hope to welcome you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great hotel with great service
data.text: I usually don't stay at non branded hotels. However, my stay here was wonderful. It is in the heart of Cincinnati. The hotel is wonderful with all the art it displays. They service is also great.  A must stay in cincinnati.

owner_response.author: Michael D, General Manager at 21c Museum Hotel Cincinnati, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for sharing your great feedback about your recent stay here, for letting us know how much you enjoyed the art, location, and service. We are grateful that you gave us a try but we should warn you that 21c is growing (number 7 opens in Nashville next year with 8 and 9 on the horizon) and it may not be long before one opens near you. Not to worry: we are all as unique as the art we exhibit! Thank you also for your recommendation and we hope to welcome you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Perfection for vacation (maybe not for business)
data.text: Hip, happening, YOUNG, capable adults man the "front desk" taking care of everything from checking in to handling bags; art gallery setup makes for a unique experience for the historic former Metropole Hotel (the 1919 Baseball tour also stops inside 21c Museum Cincinnati).  Luxurious bed and bathroom within admittedly small rooms.  Blazing fast internet.  "Artistic" bathroom fixtures look wonderful but perhaps do not function to allow for efficient bathroom sink and shower use.  An easy recommendation for vacations and weddings, this hotel may not be a good solution for a business minded traveler (although the fast WiFi might say otherwise).

owner_response.author: Michael D, General Manager at 21c Museum Hotel Cincinnati, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay (and appreciate the notice for the 1919 Baseball Tour) and we are addressing the plumbing issues that you mention. If you do happen to need a place for business travel, we do offer larger rooms designed with surfaces on which to spread out and a number of meeting spaces in and around the museum spaces. No matter what the occasion, we look forward to welcoming you again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

user_location.name: New York City, New York, USA

data.title: Museums Are A Nice Place To Visit, But Not Stay At
data.text: Sorry. Did not really enjoy this hotel. I thought I would, but I didn’t. Yes, it’s hip. Or at least it is trying very hard to be hip. Location is awesome. Lots of great restaurants nearby and the art center next door is wonderful. Staff was good too. Accommodating. But the building is old—albeit remodeled—and noisy. Walls seem paper thin. The air conditioning in my room didn’t work right and was very, very noisy every time it turned off and on. I just think for the money, the value isn’t here.

owner_response.author: Michael D, General Manager at 21c Museum Hotel Cincinnati, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello Jack,
We appreciate your comments about your recent stay. No need to apologize; we are sorry that we didn't knock your socks off. We'd love to be able to welcome you back for a chance to wow you all the way around. I would like to learn more about your experience; please feel free to reach out to me at mdunbar @ 21cHotels.com. Thank you again for your feedback.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great idea; terrible execution
data.text:
Let's begin with our arrival! A lack of a doorman/bellman left us, after a long journey, to fight with two sets of heavy doors and a number of suitcases since we were also transporting work materials. Reaching the front desk, we were greeted by very energetic, yet moderately clueless millennials who gave us a key but neglected to even tell us where the elevators were (behind the gallery door in a hallway), never mind assist us to our room. 

We arrived on the room floor, found our room, which was a ridiculously overpriced version of a junior suite. 

The sparse furnishings were sort of hip, as we expected,  but not as functional as they could have been, very far from the luxury status the price of the room warranted. 

No one knew where the safe was, the towels and were insufficient, the lighting insufficient, the tiniest bathroom rugs which did virtually nothing but supply us with something to trip over! Terrible shower head with little water pressure. Sunken bathtub had no safety features whatsoever and no working drain. Maelin and Goetz toiletries best part of room, yet only one bar of soap for two people... With bathtub shower and two sinks!

We ate brunch downstairs, which was good, but it took a lot to get this staff on point. Example....Three reminders to bring tea and we were the only ones there. Be prepared to wait. A lot. Then hope for the best.. If they remember you!

We felt like everyone in the hotel was stoned. The elevators stunk of pot the whole stay. It was a very expensive, very strange stay. I would highly recommend going around the corner and staying, instead at a less hip, yet highly efficient hotel with a well trained staff. This hotel should've paid us to stay there! Too bad, as the concept was good, but it seemed like a trust fund hipster's folly. Not a way to run a first class hotel! We won't be back.

owner_response.author: Michael D, General Manager at 21c Museum Hotel Cincinnati, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for sharing your comments about your recent stay with us. I am sorry your experience did not meet your expectations; it certainly did not meet ours. I would love an opportunity to welcome you back to 21c. Please feel free to reach out to me at mdunbar @ 21cHotels.com to further discuss your experience. Thank you again for your invaluable feedback.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wedding Weekend
data.text: We had a wonderful time in Cincinnati for a family wedding.  The hotel staff was very accommodating for our wedding party and guests needs.  The rooms were very comfortable and quiet - in spite of all the noise wedding celebrations can make. The only issue was a few of the guest rooms were not ready at check in due to late check outs - so it made for some stress on guests who needed to check in promptly so they could get ready for the wedding events.

owner_response.author: Michael D, General Manager at 21c Museum Hotel Cincinnati, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for leaving such great feedback. It was a real pleasure hosting the wedding and our team reported several wonderful interactions with the guests. While we do our best to head off the timing issues you described, these situations are occasionally unavoidable, and we are sorry for the stress and inconvenience they caused. We are glad that you were comfortable in your room, and that noise was not an issue; everyone deserved a good night's sleep after all that fun. Again, we appreciate your comments and we hope to welcome you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: I Am A Little Bit Cooler For Staying Here
data.text:
Such a pleasant experience! We were in town for the final Reds/Cubs game of the season.  We basically chose this hotel for the location.  However, we didn't expect to enjoy it as much as we did.  From start to finish the staff was absolutely excellent!  The gentleman who checked us in gave us the rundown of the hotel along with some history.  He was very knowledgeable and friendly.  We felt in good hands.  

We wound up getting an upgrade to a luxury suite.  It's a shame we were only there one night.  The decor was great.  Quite fitting for a modern art museum hotel.  The shower was incredible. It has to be the size of my living room.  The towels were luxuriously large and thick.  The double sink made us feel at home.  Bed was super comfortable.  Bottles of water were provided.  It was everything a hotel should be.

We explored the art museum when we arrived back at the hotel after the game and some dinner.  Then we stopped in the lounge for a cocktail which was wonderful.  We were a little bummed that the rooftop lounge was closed on Sunday.  However, we still managed to enjoy ourselves.

I should probably ding a star off due to the loud street traffic in the morning...we stayed on the third floor.  However, the overall experience was so wonderful I have to overlook that.  The front desk gentleman told us they were putting sound proof windows (or something) up eventually.  That will help.

Yes, stay here.  It is a unique experience and I really do feel a little bit cooler for staying here.  Enjoy!

owner_response.author: Michael D, General Manager at 21c Museum Hotel Cincinnati, responded to this review
owner_response.text: And we are definitely cooler for you having stayed here. Thank you so much for the excellent feedback and for sharing how we exceeded your expectations during your recent stay here, even to the point of overlooking the minor negative of our lively surroundings. Your comfort is paramount and knowing all the little things that you enjoyed means a lot to us: we'll be sure to keep rocking the plush towels, delicious cocktails and the quirky showers. We are sorry that the Cocktail Terrace was closed during your stay; we hope you'll have a chance to get up there when you are back for the Cub series next season!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not your typical stuffy hotel
data.text:
This hotel is a lovely place in a great location. The staff here are very attentive and the service is great.

It's a fantastic alternative if you're tired of the usual Hiltons and Marriotts. 

Thumbs up!

owner_response.author: Michael D, General Manager at 21c Museum Hotel Cincinnati, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are delighted by you wonderful comments. Thank you for taking time to share them. We strive to be that fantastic alternative and we appreciate your recommendation. We hope to welcome you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
